title: Narsis, Council Quarter - Hlaalu Family 2 Manor
description: TR_Narsis_140 - Hlaalu Family 2 Manor   The richest mansion in the entire province. Home of the Hlaalu Grandmaster. Above ground portion includes the vast entry hall, the banquet hall, the guest suite (which has, over the years, hosted the likes of Kings, Queens, and Emperors), the private quarters (which include beds for a few of the more lazy sons of John Narsis, as well as a private bath area), and the Grandmaster's Quarters (which houses John Narsis and his wife) The below ground portion includes a large library as its centerpiece, which branches off into a service wing (with comfortable quarters for the head butler, the head chef, and John Narsis' personal healer--also connects to the banquet hall), slave quarters, office for the grandmaster/meeting area, a secret basement (meeting room, assassin rooms [one of the assassins is a trainer]), and a large opulent vault filled with plenty of goodies (especially sapphires). As said, this is  the  richest mansion in the province, so should be cluttered accordingly. Ebonyware across the board, and large rooms with clutter as opulent as possible.   Furniture: De_R Shell: T_De_SetHla_X_Narsis_B_20 Cell: Narsis, Council Quarter 6, -51    Please refer to the Hlaalu Interior Style Guide:  https://www.tamriel-rebuilt.org/content/hlaalu-interior-style-guide

title: Leviathan Keep
description: In the early years of the Septim Dynasty, Leviathan Keep was an an important stronghold of the North Navy. Just before the War of the Red Diamond, the fortress was targeted by Imperial and Dunmer forces aligned with Uriel Mantiarco in his (successful) bid to unseat Empress Kintyra II and become Emperor Uriel III. The Empress' consort, Kontin Arynx, was killed defending the keep.   Leviathan Keep has been a ruin since this sack in 3E 121. Please build this interior to be thoroughly ruined by the siege and three centuries of decay. It would also be good to include some remnants of battle, including the skeleton of Kontin Arynx in gold imperial armor somewhere in the ruin.   Any furniture should follow typical fort standards, with P/M used in common areas and R used in officer's quarters   The exterior counterpart to this interior is found in the  Sea of Ghosts Islands  claim until the ext gets reviewed and merged into Mainland.

title: [Narsis] Vandirelyon Stronghold
description: Vandirelyon Chimeri stronghold  south west of Othmura  that is going to be the central piece for the Othmura Mages Guild questline.   This should be a good opportunity for puzzles and various challenges that require magic skills to progress - a collapsed bridge for levitation, a narrow hole for telekinesis, a Daedric sigil gate (see Firewatch Mages Guild).   Kevin 's Othmura Mages Guild  Proposal Doc  (WIP).   Pralec 's suggestions:     Mages Guild leader wants to lodge an expedition to investigate Vandirelyon, but can't because the surface ruins are occupied by houseless Velothi squatters. Either convince the leaders of Ald Iuval to let the squatters move into their already decrepit and overcrowded town (remember your vows to protect the Waters March), or recruit Hlaalu Guards from the governor of Othmura to clear them out. You can also just kill them yourself, but the guild leader doesn't like it very much.   The front door to Vandirelyon is locked. Expedition leader suggests that the previous tenants might know more about unlocking it. If you relocated them to Ald Iuval you can go talk to them, or otherwise find a journal left in the dome for the information. Turns out one of the younger members of the group had found the key and was sneaking into the stronghold. Worried that this would result in disaster, the eldest member of the group took the key and chucked it in the river. Use Detect Key to find the key, or use Open Lock 100 to unlock the door, or levitate to the roof, go in through the top, and find a key in the interior to unlock the door.   There is a sigil gate in the lower levels of Vandirelyon, preventing deeper access. The expedition leader says that a matching sigil amulet is needed to unlock the gate. Reading some old records in the stronghold will reveal that the amulet was kept in the Propylon Chamber. But when you try to open the Propylon chamber, the door won't budge - there has been a collapse on the other side. You need to find the Propylon index to get into the chamber. There will be hints in the stronghold that the Propylon index is at [Location]   Once you've got the Sigil Amulet, go through the gate. There are some puzzle-y rooms to go through on the lower levels, like a lever on the other side of a room that you need levitation or telekinesis to reach. At the lowest level is a Daedric Artifact that the Expedition Leader wants. When you pick it up, a Dremora Lord is summoned.     Kevin 's reply:     I really like the different obstacles / puzzles you described. Especially the way you use the blocked Propylon Chamber. Thanks for all this inspiration.   I would like to include more Redoran-Hlaalu tension than mentioned here. However, I do agree it should take place in/around the stronghold. Perhaps the overseer simply shows up unannounced. Alternatively, strongly-worded letters might arrive to annoy the mages. Furthermore, making the squatters houseless (instead of vaguely backed by house Hlaalu) removes that sense of Hlaalu encroachment I was hoping to create. In your write-up, it feels like the player can avoid dealing with more than one house entirely. (Maybe that's desired, but it was sort of the inspiration behind this questline for me.)   I liked Q2 as it sets the pace for the quest quite well. In addition to magical exploration, there's a physical barrier (rocks/rubble) that is being removed while the player deals with the obstacles you mentioned. Recruiting miners and getting supplies is also a good excuse to show the player both towns, and have common folk talk about the local tension. These barriers don't need to be grand: they can be as simple as a new trapdoor being uncovered. This also plays into the idea of "two forces": Hlaalu/Redoran, Magic/Physical, Mages Guild/Imperial Archaeology Society.   Also, I hope I can keep the finale (Q4) largely the same with the player showing up and finding everyone gone. I wanted the player to feel a sense of dread and surprise. However, I understand if that doesn't work lore-wise. Could a dremora spellcaster trap Gilen and the miners + overseer in another realm temporarily?     P. S. The  old Vandirelyon interior  shall be repurposed for Sundered Scar due to it's vulcanic theme.

title: Narsis, Catacombs
description: TR_Narsis_Catacombs    TO BE HELD IN DESIGN PENDING TESTING   A massive necropolis carved directly into the cliffs, the catacombs were a burial site for the clans who sheltered beneath the mesa when Narsis was first founded and looks more like an ashlander burial cavern than modern ancestral tombs. The catacombs have fallen into gradual disrepair as families started creating separate ancestral tombs outside the city and transferring their ancestors to them, causing many parts to become inaccessible and become home to vermin, mad spirits and “other things”(Ghouls? Cultists? Will need discussion.)   The Hlaalu first family maintains the entrance and patrols between it and the “haunted sewers”, but otherwise treat it as a fully hostile dungeon.   For the set claimants need to follow a style of mixed set design, Shipal Caves using velothi and hlaalu decorations: see image references. The catacombs being a fully unique location, we are allowed to bend/break many usual rules that have been frowned on in recent years, but it must be stressed that this is an exception which proves the current rules.   The south should have a connection to the haunted section of the Foreign Quarter sewers, and the northwest a connection to the Tribunal Temple via a long winding tunnel   Cell: Narsis 6,-51

title: Stendarr Tower Haunting cutter
description: This is the interior claim of a cutter ship that will be enabled for one of the OE  Stendarr Tower Haunting  quest endings, where the player convinces the local authorities to patrol the Thirr delta to confiscate any ash statues being smuggled through there. It should contain confiscated ash statues (along with other illegal goods they would have picked up alongside them, like moon sugar and Dwemer artifacts), a cell for captured smugglers, and optionally one or two hammocks for crew to nap in on longer patrols. It doesn't need to be laid out for long voyages as its patrol route is very near OE. The exterior positon (for the Northmarker) will be updated when it is placed in TR_Mainland, but for now the interior can be made without the northmarker. Quick overview of coastguard loadout (in comparison with the Imperial Navy):

description: TR_Sharai_04 - Earthly Delights Exterior Location:  Shipal-Sharai (- 1, -50) For this claim, please work from the attached file above. The shell has already been created and ext-matched to fit the city's tight layout. You may change up the layout, just be mindful not to go over the allocated space or to place tiles in empty space. Do not move load doors or windows. Exterior may not perfect match at this time, do not worry as this will be fixed on a final exterior pass.   Interior has space for the store as well as living space for the merchant and family. Though the current owner lives alone as the rest of their family has moved on.   Multi-generational family business started back during the mining boom of the town. Once a higher end store specializing in buying, selling, and appraising precious gems and metals from local adventurous prospectors and crafting jewelry and other items to sell to merchants.  Now that the mines have dried up the owner has taken some less scrupulous actions to keep making money. Including buying stolen jewelry and items from bandits and other illegal goods.   Store has a tunnel section that leads down into the mines for the purpose of moving stolen and illegal goods easier. Try to hide the entrance in the back room behind some boxes or the like.   Use  de_m  furniture in the store and living area.  Use  de_p  in the cavern section.       Please refer to the Hlaalu Interior Style Guide:  https://www.tamriel-rebuilt.org/content/hlaalu-interior-style-guide

title: Narsis, Council Quarter - Hlaalu Grand Council Hall
description: TR_Narsis_Council - Hlaalu Grand Council Hall   The grand seat of power for House Hlaalu. The main above-ground chunk of the building has 5 major parts.     Lobby–the first room you walk into from the main doors. When you walk in from the outside, the door right in front of you should lead to the Grand Council, and doors on the left and right should lead to a Petitioner’s Hall and a Courtroom respectively.   Grand Council–where the Hlaalu Council meets, it’s a big deal when it’s in use. Right behind the lobby, and is a room that is 3 tiles high (will most likely need a custom mesh so it’s not so squarish). The upper levels should have individual booths for the Councilors. Maybe a balcony ring on the second level, with the main floor at the bottom for speakers.   Petitioner’s Hall–a hall where citizens can present small civil concerns, and general proclamations are made. Main hall is 2 tiles high. Should have a stairwell at the back leading to the top floors.   Courtroom–a full legal court for high-profile trials. Main hall is 2 tiles high. Should have a stairwell at the back leading to the top floors.   The space on top of the ground floor halls (4th floor on top of the Grand Council, 3rd and 4th on top of the flanking halls) includes offices for clerks and lawyers, break rooms, and other things of that nature. There should be general office space for clerks/lawyers with de_m furniture, and then individual offices for the following people (using de_r furniture): Hlaalu Chief Justice, Hlaalu Chief Clerk, Hlaalu City Architect, Hlaalu Chief Inquisitor (prosecutor).     There are 3 towers:     Steward’s Tower–the tower on the left is the residence of the Narsis Grand Council’s Steward. The Steward attends the day-to-day council business such as being the primary Hlaalu questgiver in Narsis and running the Petitioner’s Hall. The lower floors of the tower should have offices for the Steward’s personal clerks and staff. Above that should be office space for the Steward and living quarters. Be sure that the bedroom is not at the very top floor, because without elevators and air conditioning, the lower the better. Instead of a single stairwell with stackable stairs, some spiralling/alternating stair locations would be better.   Vizier’s Tower–the tower on the right is the residence and workplace of the Vizier of Narsis, the Hlaalu Grandmaster’s most trusted adviser. He is essentially a court mage who is also the Hlaalu’s Spymaster. There should be accommodations for one or two sub-viziers near the bottom of the tower, who act as legal experts, spy coordinators, and mystics. The residence of the Vizier above should be fairly open (with some double height rooms), including an office, living quarters, and places for magical study. Instead of a single stairwell with stackable stairs, some spiralling/alternating stair locations would be better.   Bailiff’s Tower–the smaller tower in the center is the residence and workplace of the Hlaalu Bailiff. This is the top Marshal in the city, with the Canyon Watch, River Watch, and Council Guard Captains all reporting to him. Should include an office and a living space.     Sub-Levels should include slave quarters (de_p), some accomodations for clerks and Hlaalu Retainers (not all of the clerks though, as some have houses in St. Veloth Quarter. Use de_m), generic storerooms, and a small kitchen (de_m). One of the storerooms should have a guarded trapdoor that leads to the Council Quarter Sewers. Below all of this should be the Vault (de_r), which is the main Vault of House Hlaalu, glittering with riches (putting aside personal vaults such as the Grandmaster’s). Should be designed like a dungeon, with side rooms, places for Guards to Ambush the player (but also ways for the player to sneak past Guards), traps, etc.   Note: easy navigability is imperative, feel free to pad out the free space as much as you need with hallways   Hlaalu guide:  https://www.tamriel-rebuilt.org/content/hlaalu-interior-style-guide   Furniture: de_r (unless otherwise specified) Shell - T_De_SetHla_X_Narsis_B_19 Cell: Narsis 6,-51
